blitzmax.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the BlitzMax language server.

blitzmax.pref.showProblemsOnBuildError.description: Display the problems view on build task errors.

blitzmax.pref.jumpToProblemOnBuildError.description: Jump to the first problem on build task errors.

blitzmax.pref.showBuildProgress.description: Show build progress notification for build tasks.

blitzmax.lsp.path.markdownDescription: Relative or absolute path to the [LSP](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Alsp).

blitzmax.lsp.multi.markdownDescription: Run a separate instance of the [LSP](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Alsp) per workspace folder.

blitzmax.lsp.hotReload.markdownDescription:
Restart [LSP](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Alsp) if changes to the [LSP](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Alsp) binary are detected.  
*(only supported on Linux)*

blitzmax.help.customStyle.description: Use custom CSS style for help documentation.

blitzmax.formatter.path.markdownDescription: Relative or absolute path to external [code formatter](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Aformatter).

blitzmax.formatter.onType.markdownDescription: [Code formatter](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Aformatter) arguments when using VS Code option `Format On Type`.

blitzmax.formatter.useRange.markdownDescription: Use range arguments instead of sending text selection when [formatting code](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Aformatter).

blitzmax.formatter.range.start.markdownDescription: [Code formatter](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Aformatter) arguments for start of format range.

blitzmax.formatter.range.end.markdownDescription: [Code formatter](https://github.com/search?q=topic%3ABlitzMax+topic%3Aformatter) arguments for end of format range.

Set As Default Build Task Source File

viewsWelcome.contents:
Open a BlitzMax file or folder to edit your BlitzMax build options here.
[Open File](command:workbench.action.files.openFile)
[Open Folder](command:vscode.openFolder)
To learn more about BlitzMax NG [visit our homepage](https://blitzmax.org/).
Set your BlitMax path and make sure module documentation are built.

markdownEnumDescriptions:
Builds an applicatio from a single root source file  
`bmk makeapp)`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#makeapp)

Builds a set of modules  
`bmk makemods)`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#makemods)

On Win3, builds a dynamic linked library (DLL) from the source file  
`bmk makelib)`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#makelib)

onlycompile.markdownDescription:
Compile sources only, no building of the application  
`bmk compile`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#compile)

source.markdownDescription:
Absolute path to root source file  
`bmk <source>`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#command-line-syntax)

fullcompile.markdownDescription:
Recompiles all source/modules regardless of timestamp  
`bmk -a`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-a)

appstub.markdownDescription:
Builds an app using a custom appstub  
`bmk -b <custom appstub module>`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-b-custom-appstub-module)

hidpi.markdownDescription:
Specifies that the application supports high-resolution screens  
`bmk -hi`

gdb.markdownDescription:
Generates line mappings suitable for GDB debugging  
`bmk -gdb`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-gdb)

gprof.markdownDescription:
Gprof is a performance analysis tool for Unix applications  
`bmk -gprof`

universal.markdownDescription:
Creates a Universal build for supported platforms (Mac OS X and iOS)  
`bmk -i`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-i)

target.markdownDescription:
Cross-compiles to the specific target platform  
`bmk -l <target-platform>`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-l-target-platform)

musl.markdownDescription:
Enables musl libc compatibility (Linux NG only)  
`bmk -musl`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-musl)

nostrictupgrade.markdownDescription:
Don't upgrade strict method void return types, if required  
`bmk -nostrictupgrade`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-nostrictupgrade)

output.markdownDescription:
Specifies the output file relative to the workspace foder  
`bmk -o <output-file>`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-o-output-file)

quick.markdownDescription:
Do not scan modules for changes  
`bmk -quick`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-quick)

standalone.markdownDescription:
Generate but do not compile into binary form  
`bmk -standalone`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-standalone)

funcargcasting.markdownDescription:
How to handle function argument casting issues  
`bmk -w`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-w)

framework.markdownDescription:
Defines to use a specific module as framework  
`bmk -f <framework>`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-f-framework)

nomanifest.markdownDescription:
Do not generate a manifest file for the built application  
`bmk -nomanifest`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-nomanifest)

single.markdownDescription:
Disabled multi threaded processing in a bmk built with thread support  
`bmk -single`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-single)

nodef.markdownDescription:
Do not generate .def files useable by created DLLs/shared libraries  
`bmk -nodef`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-nodef)

nohead.markdownDescription:
Do not generate header files useable by created DLLs/shared libraries  
`bmk -nohead`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-nohead)

override.markdownDescription:
Sets requirement for overriding methods and functions to append override to their definitions  
`bmk -override`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-override)

overerr.markdownDescription:
Defines missing override keywords in overridden methods and functions to be handled as error instead of warning  
`bmk -overerr`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-overerr)

nopie.markdownDescription:
Do not generate PIE binaries (Linux only)  
`bmk -no-pie`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-no-pie)

upx.markdownDescription:
Compress the created binary with UPX  
`bmk -upx`  
[More info](https://blitzmax.org/docs/en/tools/bmk/#-upx)
